Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NETWORK_TYPE_METERED was changed to NETWORK_TYPE_CELLULAR in API 28" (#1907) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
According to the Android docs, the `NETWORK_TYPE_METERED` constant was deprecated in favor of `NETWORK_TYPE_CELLULAR`. This appears to be just a name change, but We can do the same in C#.

See the official docs here: 
https://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/job/JobInfo.html#NETWORK_TYPE_CELLULAR

VS Version info:
https://gist.github.com/mattleibow/c996be18c11dc6b380c24035f696788f

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "SIGSEGV in Skia on specific device" (#1791) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Download https://github.com/luhenry/CrashGPS/tree/newcrash and open solution file from `GPS.Kernel.Project.Xamarin`
2. Launch on dedicated device
3. Click on any of the button

### Expected Behavior

It doesn’t crash. The _equivalent_ Java app (available in `GPS.Kernel.Project.Java`) properly shows the components without crashing.

### Actual Behavior

It does crash.

### Version Information

It only crashes with a very specific device. It is being shipped to @jonpryor so he can take a look. It also crashes with latest XA stable and doesn’t seem to be version specific.

### Log File

The stacktrace appears to be in Skia, even if SkiaSharp is not in use.

 _coming soon_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Large libraries in binding causing dx error with too large of main dex file" (#1888) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

We've encountered a case where a pretty large .jar file in a Xamarin.Android binding project is causing the app project consuming it to hit a dx error:

```
com.android.dex.DexException: Too many classes in --main-dex-list, main dex capacity exceeded
    	at com.android.dx.command.dexer.Main.processAllFiles(Main.java:548)
    	at com.android.dx.command.dexer.Main.runMultiDex(Main.java:368)
    	at com.android.dx.command.dexer.Main.runDx(Main.java:289)
    	at com.android.dx.command.dexer.Main.main(Main.java:247)
    	at com.android.dx.command.Main.main(Main.java:94)
```

Now, on the Android Studio side, this can be mitigated by using the dex options:
```
dexOptions {
    preDexLibraries = true
    jumboMode = true
    keepRuntimeAnnotatedClasses false
}
```

In Xamarin, we can specify _some_ of these options:
```
<DxExtraArguments>--force-jumbo </DxExtraArguments>
```

However, there appears to be no way to do the equivalent of `keepRuntimeAnnotatedClasses false`.

Upon further investigation, it seems that `com.android.multidex.MainDexListBuilder` which is what we invoke from google's build-tools to generate the main dex list keep file, does not offer any ability to *not* keep runtime annotated classes, and these classes are added to the main dex keep list file no matter what.  So, gradle appears to generate this list some other way, or at least have the ability to remove these cases from the list before invoking dx.

I also looked to see if there was an opportunity to wire up a custom msbuild task to _intercept_ the `multidex.keep` file we generate and make changes to it, before we pass it to `dx.jar`, but unfortunately those operations happen within the same msbuild task so that doesn't appear to be possible.

One possible solution that comes to mind is to introduce some sort of `MainDexListRemove` msbuild property in which we could specify a file containing classes that should be removed from the `multidex.keep` file, that the Xamarin.Android build task would take into consideration after the file is created, and make changes to, before it's passed to dx.  This could mean the nuget package for the binding could include such a `multidex.remove` file in the .nupkg, with a targets file that sets the msbuild property so that apps consuming the binding would hopefully compile.

Thoughts?

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] Add ExtraArgs support to `CreateMultiDexMainDexClassList`." (#1896) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context #1888

The component team need the ability to pass additional arguments
to the `com.android.multidex.MainDexListBuilder`. Specifically
they need to pass `--disable-annotation-resolution-workaround`.

Since we don't want to do that on all apps, we should add the ability
for them to provide those values in the `csproj` of the binding.

This commit adds `$(AndroidMultiDexClassListExtraArgs)` which will be
appended to the `CreateMultiDexMainDexClassList` command line.
This will allow the team to pass any additional arguments they need.

Events.RelatedBody:

for now we don't need to look for the registration methods.

The `TryRegisterNativeMembers` is quite slow and needs an update. See
https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/1898.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[CodeBehind] Fix code generation for layouts with non-element root" (#1889) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
If the Android layout file being processed has an XML node other than an
element (e.g. a comment) directly following the XML declaration node, the
generator fails to properly locate the root element and will miss any namespace
declarations on it, as well as the `xamarin:classes` attribute.

This results in failure to generate partial class code and will also cause an
error to parse any elements with the `xamarin:managedType` attribute further
down in the layout file.

The fix is to skip over non-element nodes until we find the first element one
and then attempt to read namespaces and other attributes.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "monodroid.so can't find other mono .so libraries in Android Things OEM application" (#1906) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm using a Raspberry pi and running Android Things on it.

The Android Things console allows a developer to upload their applications and include them on the OEM image.

You would then burn this image to a SD Card and use said card in a Raspberry Pi.

In the attached zip, please find
copy of custom powershell scrpt
copy of logcat

I have no way of attaching the .apk files that I have

let me know where to drop them as I am sure they will help in diagnosing whats going on.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a hello world Xamarin Android Application 
2. Set Build Config to Release, Turn off Shared Runtime.
3. Archive the application, creating an apk.
4. Run attached script to remove .so files,add them back uncompressed,zip align and re-sign the apk
5. Create an Android Things Account and create a Raspberry Pi build with latest Android Things version.
        a. Add you new apps apk to the Android Things Build
6. Download develpopment version of the build
7. Burn downloaded .iso to a sd card
8. place SD Card in Raspberry Pi and boot up
9. App begins to boot, but falls over with this error:

06-29 19:30:08.060: W/monodroid(27608): Trying to load sgen from: /oem/app/MicroSemiAudioTest.MicroSemiAudioTest/lib/arm/libmonosgen-2.0.so
06-29 19:30:08.060: W/monodroid(27608): Trying to load sgen from: /oem/app/MicroSemiAudioTest.MicroSemiAudioTest/lib/arm/libmonosgen-32bit-2.0.so
06-29 19:30:08.060: W/monodroid(27608): Trying to load sgen from: /system/lib/libmonosgen-2.0.so
06-29 19:30:08.060: A/monodroid(27608): cannot find libmonosgen-2.0.so in app_libdir: /oem/app/MicroSemiAudioTest.MicroSemiAudioTest/lib/arm nor in previously printed locations.
06-29 19:30:08.060: A/monodroid(27608): Do you have a shared runtime build of your app with AndroidManifest.xml android:minSdkVersion < 10 while running on a 64-bit Android 5.0 target? This combination is not supported.
06-29 19:30:08.060: A/monodroid(27608): Please either set android:minSdkVersion >= 10 or use a build without the shared runtime (like default Release configuration).
06-29 19:30:08.108: I/ActivityManager(302): Process MicroSemiAudioTest.MicroSemiAudioTest (pid 27608) has died: fore TOP 

It seems that monodroid cannot find the other .so files.

This is probably due to the following:

1.) The app is installed in the OEM partition
2.) The .so files are read from the apk directly and not copied/extracted.

My best guess is that monodroid is looking where the files would be copied if it were a standard application installation.  But since this app is in the oem folder, the libraries are read directly from there in their uncompressed state.

### Expected Behavior
The monodroid library would find and load the libraries in the /oem/app/MicroSemiAudioTest.MicroSemiAudioTest/app.apk

AND NOT look in
/oem/app/MicroSemiAudioTest.MicroSemiAudioTest/lib/arm/ which does not exist

### Actual Behavior
monodroid library assumes the files location in /oem/app/MicroSemiAudioTest.MicroSemiAudioTest/lib/arm/ and falls over when it cannot be loaded


### Version Information
Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2017 
Version 15.7.1
VisualStudio.15.Release/15.7.1+27703.2000
Microsoft .NET Framework
Version 4.7.03056

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[build] fix for *new* TargetFrameworkVersion during nuget restore" (#1905) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: http://build.devdiv.io/1820059

Since f9a7cfc, NuGet restore has been failing for `Xamarin.Android-Tests.sln`:

    Error XA0000: Could not determine API level for $(TargetFrameworkVersion) of 'v9.0'. [E:\A\_work\2\s\src\Mono.Android\Test\Mono.Android-Tests.csproj]

When running:

    .nuget\NuGet.exe restore Xamarin.Android-Tests.sln -Verbosity Detailed

There is a little more insight into how NuGet works:

    C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Enterprise\MSBuild\15.0\bin\msbuild.exe
        "C:\Users\myuser\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\rh0oot0c.d22.nugetinputs.targets"
        /t:GenerateRestoreGraphFile /nologo /nr:false /v:q
        /p:NuGetRestoreTargets="C:\Users\myuser\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\zzcd4yd1.a0q.nugetrestore.targets"
        /p:RestoreUseCustomAfterTargets="True"
        /p:RestoreTaskAssemblyFile="C:\Users\myuser\Desktop\Git\xamarin-android\.nuget\NuGet.exe"
        /p:RestoreSolutionDirectory="C:\Users\myuser\Desktop\Git\xamarin-android"
        /p:SolutionDir="C:\Users\myuser\Desktop\Git\xamarin-android"
        /p:RestoreBuildInParallel="False" /p:RestoreUseSkipNonexistentTargets="False"

Apparently this targets file:

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/5244dc7596f0cc0ed65984dc8c040d23b0e9c09b/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Build.Tasks/NuGet.targets

Is extracted and invoked through MSBuild.

Then `<ResolveSdks />` from the system install fails, because it does
not know what `TargetFrameworkVersion=v9.0` is yet!

So a "hacky" solution is:
- Don't set `TargetFrameworkVersion` if NuGet is running
- Set `AndroidUseLatestPlatformSdk=True` instead

We can detect if NuGet is running by using a property from the above
command:

    <_IsRunningNuGetRestore Condition="$(RestoreTaskAssemblyFile.EndsWith('NuGet.exe'))">True</_IsRunningNuGetRestore>

By leaving `AndroidFrameworkVersion` blank in `Configuration.props`,
it fixes `TargetFrameworkVersion` in our projects, because they do
this:

    <Import Project="..\..\..\Configuration.props" />
    <PropertyGroup>
      <TargetFrameworkVersion>$(AndroidFrameworkVersion)</TargetFrameworkVersion>
    </PropertyGroup>

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "ListView separators on iOS has space/gap on left side. Cannot be fixed with margin property." (#3196) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

ListView separators on iOS have a gap on the left hand side.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new page.
2. Add a ListView control to the page.
3. Observe left margin for separators on iOS device.

### Expected Behavior

List view separators should span entire screen width to match the control width.

### Actual Behavior

Gap on left.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.0.0.482510
- Last known good version: n/a
- IDE: Visual studio Mac

### Reproduction XAML

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ContentPage xmlns="http://xamarin.com/schemas/2014/forms" xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2009/xaml" x:Class="...">
    <ContentPage.Content>
            <ListView>
            </ListView>
    </ContentPage.Content>
</ContentPage>
```

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4529974/42138690-5e3daf4c-7d79-11e8-98e8-0b1978be8ce5.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Fix UWP ScrollViewer Horizontal Scroll Bar Visibility when set before" (#3195) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

The UpdateOrientation method was resetting the horizontal scroll bar visibility when it was explicitly set by the user.  This change checks to see if the user set the value and if so respects that instead of setting it based on the Scrollview orientation. 

### Issues Resolved ###

- fixes #3193 

### API Changes ###

None

Changed:
 - object ScrollViewRenderer => UpdateOrientation

### Platforms Affected ###

- UWP

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###

No change, other then to correct the behavior of Horizontal Scroll Bar Visibility. 

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [x] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "TabbedPage as Master on MasterDetailPage problems" (#3194) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
The issues could be reproduced for Xamarin Forms 3.1 (2.5 doesn't have this problem) for iOS platform only.
 took an example of Master Detail page from here

https://developer.xamarin.com/samples/xamarin-forms/Navigation/MasterDetailPage/MasterDetailPage.zip

and slightly modified it by changing Master page from Content to TabbedPage.
### Steps to Reproduce
When application starts (again iOS only all is OK for Android and UWP)

1. Master shows overlapping Detail (like IsPresented = true but it is not)
2. Master looks frozen upon start. The only way to make it moving is a click on "Contact" icon which. overlaps "sandwich" icon - master page with slide out.
3. Click on sandwich button to bring master page back over and select Tab 2
Click inside of Entry box and all page content slides to the right of master page and becomes inaccessible

### Expected Behavior
Upon application start master page should be hidden by default.
Clicking inside of Entry box should not make page contents to disappear

### Actual Behavior
Upon application start master page overlaps detail and not responsive.
Clicking inside of Entry box on tabbed page Tab2 makes all page contents diaapear

### Basic Information

- Version with issue:
3.1
- Last known good version:
2.5
- IDE:
Visual Studio for Mac 7.5.3
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  <!-- The version of the iOS SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 11.1 -->
11.12
  - Android: <!-- The version of the Android SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 7.1 --> 
N/A
  - UWP:  <!-- The version of the UWP SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 16299 --> 
N/A
- Android Support Library Version: <!-- if applicable -->
N/A
- Nuget Packages:
Xamarin.Forms 3.1
- Affected Devices:

### Screenshots

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

### Reproduction Link

<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->
Download project from here:
https://developer.xamarin.com/samples/xamarin-forms/Navigation/MasterDetailPage/MasterDetailPage.zip

Update MasterPage from here:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<TabbedPage xmlns="http://xamarin.com/schemas/2014/forms" 
			 xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2009/xaml"
             xmlns:local="using:MasterDetailPageNavigation"
			 x:Class="MasterDetailPageNavigation.MasterPage"
			 Padding="0,200,0,0"
			 Icon="hamburger.png"
			 Title="Personal Organiser">

    <ContentPage Title="Tab 1">
        <StackLayout>
            <ListView x:Name="listView" x:FieldModifier="public">
               <ListView.ItemsSource>
                    <x:Array Type="{x:Type local:MasterPageItem}">
                        <local:MasterPageItem Title="Contacts" IconSource="contacts.png" TargetType="{x:Type local:ContactsPage}" />
                        <local:MasterPageItem Title="TodoList" IconSource="todo.png" TargetType="{x:Type local:TodoListPage}" />
                        <local:MasterPageItem Title="Reminders" IconSource="reminders.png" TargetType="{x:Type local:ReminderPage}" />
                    </x:Array>
                </ListView.ItemsSource>
                <ListView.ItemTemplate>
                    <DataTemplate>
                        <ViewCell>
                            <Grid Padding="5,10">
                                <Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
                                    <ColumnDefinition Width="30"/>
                                    <ColumnDefinition Width="*" />
                                </Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
                                <Image Source="{Binding IconSource}" />
                                <Label Grid.Column="1" Text="{Binding Title}" />
                            </Grid>
                        </ViewCell>
                    </DataTemplate>
                </ListView.ItemTemplate>
            </ListView>
        </StackLayout>
    </ContentPage>

    <ContentPage Title="Tab 2">
        <StackLayout>
            <Label Text="Enter:"/>
            <Entry />
       </StackLayout>
    </ContentPage>
</TabbedPage>

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Environment.SpecialFolder.Personal Returns Locked Path" (#3192) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

The special folder path Environment.SpecialFolder.Personal on my Galaxy S8 returns a path that I can store files in, but it's in a hidden "root only" area that I can't view either when browsing on my PC via USB, or on the device itself (unless I route).

Even though the path is

/data/user/0/…

I can't access the files I'm creating.  I don't know if this is specific to the Galaxy S8.

The following all produce the same result,

System.Environment.SpecialFolder.ApplicationData
System.Environment.SpecialFolder.MyDocuments
System.Environment.SpecialFolder.Personal

### Steps to Reproduce

1.  Create a file in Environment.SpecialFolder.Personal
2.  Attempt to find it on your device, using any non-rooted method
3.  Note that you cannot even see the file, but the app can.

### Expected Behaviour

I should be able to access anything in Environment.SpecialFolder.Personal, so the path should be accessible.  Otherwise it's not a personal path if the user can't even get to the data within it.

### Actual Behaviour

Data gets "lost", although the application can read/write it fine, the user cannot access it.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue:
- Last known good version:
- IDE:
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - Android: 8.0.0
- Nuget Packages:
 - Xamarin.Android.* (27.0.2.1)
 - Xamarin.Forms (3.1.0.583944)
- Affected Devices:
 - Galaxy S8

### Reproduction Link

https://1drv.ms/u/s!AlN90gKdry3-tKdzo__P9p5UuUHaww

### What Is Your Favourite Colour?

Orange

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue " condition `mono_domain_get () == mono_get_root_domain ()' not met error on building ios sample" (#4008) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Build https://github.com/xamarin/ios-samples/tree/master/ios8/MetalImageProcessing with Release|iPhone config from command line using msbuild.

### Expected Behavior
App should build successfully

### Actual Behavior
App failed to build with an error, Assertion at /Users/builder/data/lanes/5944/7e782c1e/source/xamarin-macios/external/mono/mono/metadata/gc.c:847, condition `mono_domain_get () == mono_get_root_domain ()' not met
This is the first time  such an issue is seen in bots. 

### Environment

```
Operating System: Mac OS X 10.13.4
Mono version: 5.10.1.57 (ea8a24b1bbf)  (2018-04-24 14:53:01 -04:00)
XA version: 8.3.0.18 (HEAD/1f8462ef1) 
XI version: 11.10.1.177 (d15-7: 7e782c1e) 
XM version: 4.4.1.176 (master: 7e782c1e)  (2018-04-25 15:27:14 -04:00)
XVS version: 
XS version: 7.5.0.1212 (c82e5cc)  (2018-04-19 16:57:22 -04:00)
```

### Build Logs

Build Log: http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/report-1f27cd1cc6244f9894172c3bbec5a287.txt

### Example Project (If Possible)
https://github.com/xamarin/ios-samples/tree/master/ios8/MetalImageProcessing

## Additional Info:
I couldn't reproduce the issue on the same bot with the same command line inputs
Manual Build Log : https://gist.github.com/GouriKumari/79ad5ce69ce6c9b995ef5f56d1736d53 .
Logging this to keep track of the issue.
